name: ENEMY SOIL "Fractured Theology" LP
description:
This record was originally released back in 1998 on Profane Existence Far East as a 3''CD. After 15 years it will see the daylight on 12''! Fifteen incredible grindcore songs form one of the most influental bands ever. Recorded with T.L. Smoot of Page Ninety-nine on vocals. For fans of Terrorizer, Wadge, Sodom. Classic stuff.

Pressing of 520 copies with glossy covers with insert and A2 poster.
This include:
395 on black
80 on orange transparent
45 on orange transparent with limited screen printed covers

Available for 9 euro / 12 usd + postage.
galon@dropoutrecords.org

name: GUANATANAMO PARTY PROGRAM / WE ARE IDOLS split EP
description:
Brand new split between two bands from Wrocław, Poland. Gunatanamo Party Program puts one long tracks in vein of early Amen Ra, Cult Of Luna. Recorded during their session for upcoming full lenght. While We Are Idols present one tracks of their own entitled "End Of The Sphere" and one cover song of Fear, "I Love Livin' In The City". Both recorded during "Powerless" session. Limited edition of 343 copies on magenta dark vinyl.

Release date: December 2012

Pressing info: 343 copies (Magenta) / 100 with additional cover

Split Release with: Long Walk Records

name: UNHOLY GRAVE / NAK'AY split 5''EP
description:
One more time ... furious grindcore from Japan, third release on Drop Out! One insane song in their unique style with excellent chorous! Raw as they say & generation by generation recorded in basement on 4 track! On the flipside brand new black metal influenced crust grind from US ... Nak'ay with members of Daisycutter! Five ultra short, full on blasting songs including cover of "Feasts Of War" by Assuck. Enjoy grindcore in small doses!

Release date: May 2012

Pressing info: 1000 copies (black), few uncut test pressing (7'')

Split Release with: Haunted Hotel, Crucificados Pelo Sistema, Insurgency Records.

name: CATHETER "Southwest Doom Violence" LP
description:
After years of angst-ridden anticipation from a ravenous fanbase, Denver's grindcore gargantuans CATHETER unleash their first full-length album since 2005, celebrating 15 years of perpetuating their brutal 303-style grind. The follow-up to their 2005-released sophomore album, "Dimension 303", amidst an incredible arsenal of split releases, EPs and demos over the years, CATHETER's new opus is so obliteratingly heavy that upon first listen you'll quickly forgive them for the delay since the last album, and immediately tear your own head off in utter joy.

Release date: April 2012

Pressing info: 591 copies (black), 2 test press

Split Release with: Grindfather, Zaraza

name: WE ARE IDOLS "Powerless" LP
description:
WHITE VINYL. Second fulllenght by We Are Idols if available! Album called “Powerless” contain 11 brand new tracks, bit like and bit unlike the ones from their debut. Still good old death’n'roll but way more “death” than “roll” this time. Right inbetween The Stooges and Eyehategod. Seriously. Lyrics without puns, although sad and cruel. All of them on the matter of struggling of consciousness forced in human flesh with brute urges. Lots of symbolics and literary references. Grab some cheap whiskey and a handfull of prozac, it’s gonna be really grim. All packed in gatefold LP cover, there's also limited edition on white vinyl!

Release date: January 2012

Pressing info: 625 copies (470 black / 155 white)

Split Release with: Hasiok records, Long Walk Records, N.I.C.
